short_description: Discover Cambodia, a Southeast Asian kingdom steeped in ancient history and rich culture. Explore the magnificent Angkor Wat temple complex, experience the vibrant capital Phnom Penh, discover pristine beaches, and immerse yourself in the warm hospitality of the Khmer people.

health.tap_water_safety: Not safe to drink - bottled or filtered water is recommended
alcohol_info: It is prohibited to sell, serve, or offer alcohol beverages to anyone under the age of 18
Alcohol can be purchased from licensed venues, restaurants, and stores
US Dollar is widely accepted alongside the Cambodian Riel

tipping.hotels: Small tips for porters and housekeeping are appreciated
tipping.guides: 10% tip is appreciated for tour guides
tipping.restaurants: 10% tip is customary for good service, though not always expected
tipping.taxis: Rounding up the fare is common

weather.title: Cambodia has a tropical monsoon climate with two distinct seasons: a dry season from November to April and a wet season from May to October. The country experiences hot temperatures year-round, with the hottest period from March to May.

when_to_visit.title: Dry Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Cooler and drier weather, making this the best time to visit. Perfect for exploring Angkor Wat and other temples, visiting cities, and outdoor activities. Ideal conditions for sightseeing and cultural experiences

when_to_visit.title: Shoulder Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Transition periods with occasional rain showers. Still manageable for travel, but be prepared for some rainfall. Good time to visit before or after the peak dry season

when_to_visit.title: Wet Season
when_to_visit.short_description: Heavy rainfall and high humidity. Challenging conditions for travel, with flooding possible in some areas. Lush green landscapes but difficult for outdoor activities. Lower prices and fewer tourists

weather.best_time: The best time to visit Cambodia is during the dry season from November to April when the weather is cooler and drier, making it ideal for exploring Angkor Wat and other temples, visiting cities, and outdoor activities
